summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 discussing the status of evidence processing in the Epstein case. It involves coordination between parties regarding a spreadsheet inventory of seized devices, questions about data extraction (including ~71,000 empty files), and the physical recovery of data from failed hard drives.

events.title: Evidence Status Update Email Exchange
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the status of evidence processing, including confirmation of a comprehensive spreadsheet, identification of ~71,000 zero-byte files from initial device extractions, and plans to address physically failed drives.

keyFacts: A vendor reviewing seven initial devices reported approximately 71,000 documents that are zero bytes (empty files).
Evidence inventory includes multiple servers with drives that have physically failed, requiring specialist data recovery which may or may not be possible and is described as a very long process.
The correspondence references device identifiers (e.g., NYC024328, NYC024367, NYC027910) and uses a color-coded spreadsheet to track evidence status.
